content: Thunderbird má "modrou hrůzu" jako ikonku už roky. Pokud sis tam nacpal domeček, snad víš, jak jsi to udělal. Jinak - ikony programů v systému Windows se mění například přes menu pravého tlačítka myši. Příklad> C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs - Vlastnosti
creator: poljos-moz

content: Dík, ale to není to, o co mi šlo. Program má prostě na hlavním panelu ikonu domeček, je to v podstatě zástupe, ale po spuštění se ta ikona změní na jinou. Přesněji na originální thunderbird.exe, a ta změnit nejde. Ale ještě nedávno tam ikona zůstávala. No a prostě najednou jsem ji na liště po spuštění nemohl najít, mezi jinýma podobnýma...

content:
• po spuštění se ta ikona změní na jinou

Asi bys měl počítač zkontrolovat na škodnou (MBAM + AdwCleaner). Není normální, aby se takto chovala ikonka programu.
creator: poljos-moz

content: 1. Odstráňte ikony zástupcov Thunderbirdu z "hlavní lišty" a ak je náhodou aj na ploche, tak aj tam 2. Vyhľadajte súbor thunderbird.exe v počítači (C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe), kliknite naň pravým tlačidlom myši a vyberte "Odoslať kam.." - "Pracovná plocha - vytvoriť odkaz". Odkaz by sa mal na pracovnej ploche zobraziť a mal by mať správny obrázok ikony - ako písal poljos "modrou hrůzu". 3. Chyťte túto ikonu Thunderbirdu ("modrou hrůzu") ľavým tlačidlom myši a potiahnite ju nad "hlavní lištu" a pustite myš - "pripnite ju na Panel úloh" 4. Hotovo
creator: Ansamb

content: This indicates that the email provider, mail.dk, has changed requirements for their SMTP servers. If you post screenshot of your SMTP server settings for that account, someone here may have suggestions on what to change. We have been seeing such changes all year, as providers tighten security requirements. Some changes have been a simple as requiring full email addresses, or requiring password security.
creator: davidsk

content: You're probably right. I have uploaded screenshots of the server settings.
creator: peter.lerche

content: I suggest trying ssl/tls or starttls to see if that does it . and it may require trying different combinations of ports, either 465 or 587 to find the right combination.
creator: davidsk

content: None of the combinations ssl/tls, starttls, 465 and 587 worked. But on the starttls the system suddenly suggested 110, and that worked!!!!! Only problem now is that I still can't send mails from my phone (Android). Any suggestions?

content: I suggest making the same change to your android phone. starttls and 110. I cannot tell you the steps because each app is different.

Non credo ci sia un motivo particolare. Semplicemente Thunderbird 115 è più pesante delle versioni precedenti. Su un hardware non recente ne deriva un rallentamento delle prestazioni. Molto comunque dipende dalla dimensione dell'archivio e da come è distribuita la posta in cartelle e sottocartelle.

Più in generale, vale quanto detto qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1431017

content: Lo acabo de conseguir gracias a este vídeo en YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=trz-CMQLHZM. A partir del minuto 4:29 te dice cómo hacerlo: como si enviases un nuevo mail, configuras el tamaño de la imagen, pero en lugar de enviarlo, "guardas como" ese correo (con formato de archivo .html) y luego es ese el archivo que cuelgas en la configuración general (y no el archivo de imagen).

creator: 10bremerelane

content:
Your linked topic has so many issues it is not funny. Your request for support also has issues, primarily you do not appear to be aware Lightning has been gone from Thunderbird for years and that caldav is a protocol like carddav, IMAP or POP. Apparently you have found something that refers to the use of caldav, I do not have the benefit of knowing what that is, so have no idea where it goes off the rails, or even if it does. As David explained in that topic you linked to, you don't get to pick the caldav protocol, you get to input the URL to the caldav server that will offer the calendar.

This is slightly different for some calendar providers like Google where Thunderbird actually knows the link, so it finds your calendars for you.

At the end of the day, what caldav provider are you trying to use? If it is the apple product you are in for a world of pain, because Apple hides the endpoint and you have to read arcane apple setting files to find it. If it is google, you simply enter your gmail user name and password when prompted. Other providers requirement vary, so knowing which is being invoked makes the whole support thing immeasurably easier.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hi Matt

Thanks for the reply. Indeed I am not aware Lightning has gone from Thunderbird because I am still using it! I imagine what you are saying is that it has been absorbed into Thunderbird.

I am just trying to link up the calendar of two local boxes on the same local network. They are mirrored using syncthing. At one point in the history it was possible to just mirror the directories, but that stopped working.

I get caldav from every posse of hits when I google sync Thunderbird calendars.

If you could let me know the simplest possible way of linking my two installs I would be very grateful. I am running LInux Mint MATE 21.01.
creator: triplemaya

content: You need a caldav server to do the syncing. Apparently you do not have one, so clearly it is not going to work using caldav. A future release (in the next year) will have some version of Firefox sync. If it will do calendars or do them well I have no idea. It is currently enabled in the pre-release versions, but I have not tried it. https://download.mozilla.org/?product=thunderbird-nightly-latest-SSL&os=win64&lang=en-US
creator: MattAuSupport

content:

Will try out this new nightly for Thunderbird. But the way you phrased your message got me thinking. A quick google and I realise I can set up caldav in Cpanel in my hosting. The instructions look fairly simple so I will try that next.

Thanks for all the help. (I'm clicking on the thumbs up for your last message but it is not reacting.)
creator: triplemaya

content:
Ciao, È strano che non ti sia mai successo, sono ormai 2 anni che Google ha imposto questa nuova forma di autenticazione basata su OAUTH. Trovi altri dettagli ai seguenti link -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=76522.0 -> https://forum.mozillaitalia.org/index.php?topic=76956.0

In generale comunque dei fare il login per permettere a Thunderbird di scaricare nuovamente la posta. Lo stesso accesso ti verrà chiesto periodicamente a discrezione di Google.
